items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Squat down and place the dumbbells on the ground in front of you.
Jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your hands on the dumbbells.
Perform a push-up, lowering your chest to the ground.
Jump your feet back up to your hands, standing up with the dumbbells in your hands.
Perform a bicep curl with the dumbbells.
Press the dumbbells overhead, extending your arms fully.
Lower the dumbbells back down to your sides and repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.
Targets multiple muscle groups including legs, core, chest, and arms
Can be modified for different fitness levels
Can be done with minimal equipment
Can be incorporated into a high-intensity interval training (HIIT) routine
